hints.content: Each row has $\color{purple}4$ plants.There are $\color{green}16\color{black}$ total plants. [[image 0]] How many $\color{color{blue}}\text{groups}}$ are there?

We can write this as a multiplication problem. $\color{purple}\text{size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$So, $\color{purple}4\times\color{color{blue}}\text{?}} = \color{green}16}$

We can also write this as a division problem. $\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}=\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} $So, $\color{green}16\color{black}\div \color{purple}4=\color{color{blue}}\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many rows of tomato plants Olivia planted are: - $\color{purple}4\times\color{color{blue}}\text{?}\color{black} = \color{green}16\color{black}$ 
 - $\color{green}16\color{black}\div \color{purple}4=\color{color{blue}}\text{?}}$

question.content: Olivia planted $16$ tomato plants in rows in her new garden.  She planted $4$ plants in each row.  **Which equations would help us find out how many rows of tomato plants Olivia planted?**

hints.content: There are $\color{color{blue}}7\color{black}$ kids.There are $\color{green}35\color{black}$ total cookies. [[image 0]] What is the $\color{purple}\text{size of the groups}}$?

We can write this as a multiplication problem. $\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{size of the group}\color{black}= \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$So, $\color{color{blue}}7\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{?}} = \color{green}35}$

We can also write this as a division problem. $\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$So, $\color{green}35\color{black}\div \color{color{blue}}7\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many cookies Lance gave each kid are:   - $\color{color{blue}}7\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{?}\color{black} = \color{green}35\color{black}$
 - $\color{green}35\color{black}\div \color{color{blue}}7\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{?}}$

question.content: Lance baked $35$ cookies to give to the $7$ kids at his bus stop.  He gave each kid the same number of cookies.**Which equations would help us find out how many cookies Lance gave to each kid?**

 - $\color{green}63\color{black}\div \color{purple}9=\color{color{blue}}\text{?}}$
